name: places/ChIJdd701hBawokRU084vwqfM40
formattedAddress: 27 Trinity Pl, New York, NY 10006, USA
adrFormatAddress: 27 Trinity Pl, New York, NY 10006, USA

editorialSummary.text: Store offering shipping, packaging, printing & other services, plus office supplies.

originalText.text: Just came in to drop off a package and the attendant didn’t know how to switch the default printer to the label printer. As a former staples copy and print center attendant I myself am familiar with the label print system. Also I just saw them bar code scan and print a label for another package. I was intending to print my label on-site by emailing it to the location. But I was told the printer connected to the computer is not in operation. All they would have to do is change the default printer to the label printer to complet my request. Very disappointed now I have to walk another half mile to drop of this high box. This is a brand new location how is there printer broken already.

originalText.text:
Be aware when dealing with an employee named Michael at this UPS location, as he tends to assert himself by humiliating customers. Despite my initial excitement about the opening of UPS in this particular location, my first encounter turned into a nightmarish and disrespectful experience.
Upon requesting to have my parcel taped for added protection, Michael claimed it was impossible. Despite my insistence, he refused to assist. Additionally, the receiver's index differed from the original, and when questioned, Michael callously suggested I leave if dissatisfied. Another employee, Kevin, clarified that the system accounted for the variation and reassured me based on the zip code match.
Furthermore, Michael intentionally measured my box with exaggerated dimensions, unnecessarily increasing the shipping cost. Despite expressing my concerns, he remained rude and uncooperative. When seeking clarification on the recipient's address, his response was dismissive, suggesting I find an alternative service.
Michael should have disclosed the shipment price and inquired about the desired delivery speed. Opting for a three-day delivery, I discovered it was more expensive and slower than standard shipping. Throughout the interaction, Michael displayed a lack of professionalism and explicitly stated that I was wasting his time.
In stark contrast, my experiences with UPS on Beaver St, featuring polite and helpful employees, underscore the stark difference in customer service quality. I am disappointed that my attempt to pay for a service ended with such disdainful treatment from Michael, who appears uninterested in providing efficient and respectful customer service.

originalText.text:
Are you open or not?  I have sent email and called.  It says your call did not go thru and no one replies to the email!

Is your store open or not?  The phone number says ‘your call did not go thru’
There was a rude girl when I went there on 1/17 and my package never made it to the delivery place.  I don’t have the tracking number. I don’t know what she did

originalText.text: I just visted the new location, anticipating the worst after reading all the negative reviews. To my pleasant surprise, the staff was very polite and helpful and processed my returns in no time.

text.text: I just visted the new location, anticipating the worst after reading all the negative reviews. To my pleasant surprise, the staff was very polite and helpful and processed my returns in no time.

originalText.text: Despicable place. She couldn’t print two pages. She said they didn’t print out for you, but you had to use the computer. Although EVERY other UPS always does. After almost an hour trying, lines of angry customers forming, issuing two different cards for the computer, she came up with a tiny shrift, completely unreadable page and asked me if that was ok. I wasn’t sure if she was making fun of me at that point, or if she was actually serious. I ran out, despite of already having paid, and went to the Broad Str. UPS where the person immediately printed the pages out for less than a minute.
